Package com.bfo.json

Class JsonWriteOptions

java.lang.Object
com.bfo.json.JsonWriteOptions
public class JsonWriteOptions extends Object

This class determines how the Json written with Json.write() is formatted.

The class uses a "fluent" style to enable setting multiple options at once, eg. 

  json.write(out, new JsonWriteOptions().setPretty(true).setSorted(true));

All boolean options are false by default.

    static class 
    JsonWriteOptions.Filter
    A Filter which can be used to restrict which nodes are written, or to override the source of data for some nodes

    • setFloatFormat

      public JsonWriteOptions setFloatFormat(String format)
      The String format to use when formatting a float. The default is "%.8g" Note that superfluous trailing zeros will trimmed from any formatted value.
      Parameters:
      format - the format, which will be passed to DecimalFormat
      Returns:
      this

    • setDoubleFormat

      public JsonWriteOptions setDoubleFormat(String format)
      The String format to use when formatting a double. The default is "%.16g". Note that superfluous trailing zeros will trimmed from any formatted value.
      Parameters:
      format - the format, which will be passed to DecimalFormat
      Returns:
      this

    • setAllowNaN

      public JsonWriteOptions setAllowNaN(boolean nan)
      Whether to allow NaN and Infinite values in the output. Both NaN and infinite values are disallowed in RFC8259. With this flag set, Infinite or NaN values are serialized as null, which matches web-browser behaviour. With this flag not set, an IOException is thrown during serialization
      Parameters:
      nan - the flag
      Returns:
      this

    • setPretty

      public JsonWriteOptions setPretty(boolean pretty)
      Whether to pretty-print the Json, using newlines and indentation.
      Parameters:
      pretty - the flag
      Returns:
      this

    • setSorted

      public JsonWriteOptions setSorted(boolean sorted)
      Whether to sort the keys in each map alphabetically when writing. This is recommended, but not required for CBOR serialization
      Parameters:
      sorted - the flag
      Returns:
      this

    • setSpaceAfterColon

      public JsonWriteOptions setSpaceAfterColon(boolean spaceAfterColon)
      Whether to add a space after each colon in Json serialization.
      Parameters:
      spaceAfterColon - the flag
      Returns:
      this

    • setNFC

      public JsonWriteOptions setNFC(boolean nfc)
      Set whether to normalize all Strings (including map keys) to Unicode normal form C when writing. Note that collapsing Map keys down to NFC could theoretically result in two keys of the same value being written out. This is not tested for during writing.
      Parameters:
      nfc - the flag
      Returns:
      this

    • setMaxArraySize

      public JsonWriteOptions setMaxArraySize(int size)
      Set the maximum number of items to print in an array. Additional entries will be replaced with an ellipsis; the result will not be valid Json, but is useful for use in toString()
      Parameters:
      size - the maximum number of items to print, or 0 for no limit (the default)
      Returns:
      this

    • setMaxStringLength

      public JsonWriteOptions setMaxStringLength(int size)
      Set the maximum length of a string. Additional characters will be replaced with an ellipsis
      Parameters:
      size - the maximum length of a string to print, or 0 for no limit (the default)
      Returns:
      this

    • setBase64Standard

      public JsonWriteOptions setBase64Standard(boolean base64standard)

      When encoding a "buffer" value in JSON, it will be encoded as Base64. By default the "URL- and filename-safe character set" defined in RFC4648 is used, as this is required by JWT. However this method can be called to use the "standard" Base64 encoding, first defined in RFC1421. Prior to version 5 the default (and only option) was "standard.

      No equivalent read option exists - when reading, all Base64 variations are accepted

      Parameters:
      base64standard - the flag
      Returns:
      this
      Since:
      5

    • isBase64Standard

      public boolean isBase64Standard()
      Return the value of the "base64standard" flag as set by setBase64Standard(boolean)
      Returns:
      the flag
      Since:
      5

    • getMaxStringLength

      public int getMaxStringLength()
      Return the "maxStringLength" field as set by setMaxStringLength(int)
      Returns:
      the value

    • setCborDiag

      public JsonWriteOptions setCborDiag(String format)
      When dumping CBOR data, this flag can be set to use the "CBOR-Diag" format from RFC8949. The output for regular JSON files with this format is unaffected.
      Parameters:
      format - "hex" or "HEX" to use the hex encoding for buffers, "base64" for the base-64 encoding for buffers, or null to not use "CBOR-Diag" format
      Returns:
      this
      Since:
      5

    • getCborDiag

      public String getCborDiag()
      Return the "cborDiag" flag as set by setCborDiag(java.lang.String)
      Returns:
      the value
      Since:
      5

    • createNodeSetFilter

      public static JsonWriteOptions.Filter createNodeSetFilter(Collection<Json> set, boolean include)
      Return a simple Filter that will only print nodes that are either in, or not in the specified set
      Parameters:
      set - the set of Json objects
      include - if true, only print nodes in the set. If false, only print nodes not in the set.
      Returns:
      a new Filter instance
